comments:
3.1M2, JDK5.0rc.
All I did was debug a console-based Java program and these popped up in the 
Error Log. The program produced some output to the console, which is set up 
with a fixed width of 120. It wrote 16 lines of output, and 2 were longer than 
120 characters so they wrapped (that could be where the number 18 is coming 
from).

Values set in documentAboutToBeChanged not OK?

We had similar traces in the past. The potential problems usually included 
concurrent document modification and incorrectly managed read-only states of 
the text widget.
Fixed in IOConsoleDocumentAdapter.countLines(...). Method was ignoring the console's width.
*** Bug 75583 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 78457 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
